subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text:
* In {{w|traditional Chinese characters|traditional Chinese}} and {{w|Hanja|Korean}} scripts, the bottom right component is written {{l|mul|乂}} instead of {{l|mul|又}} (as found in the {{w|Kangxi dictionary}}).
* In {{w|simplified Chinese characters|simplified Chinese}} and {{w|Chữ Nôm|Vietnamese}} scripts, the bottom right component is written {{l|mul|又}} ({{l|mul|友}} with a dot on the top right corner).
* In Japanese, the character itself is written like the traditional Chinese form but may be {{w|Shinjitai|simplified}} to {{l|mul|友}} when used as a component for {{w|Jōyō kanji|frequently used}} characters such as {{l|mul|抜}} and {{l|mul|髪}} (dot above {{l|mul|友}} is missing).

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=94|rad=犬|as=01|sn=4|four=43040|canj=IKE,IKK|ids=⿺友丶(G),⿻犬丿(HTJK)}} <!-- Character itself not used in Vietnam -->
